news_items.headline: Twitter notches first $1 billion quarterly revenue, beating estimates; shares jump
news_items.lede: Twitter Inc pulled in $1 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time on Thursday, beating expectations as efforts to make its platform more user-friendly brought in more people, and sending its shares up 14% in early trading.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Twitter App loads on an iPhone in this illustration photograph taken in Los Angeles, California, U.S., July 22, 2019.    REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Twitter tops expectations with first $1 bln quarterly revenue, but outlook lags
news_items.lede: Twitter Inc hit $1 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time, topping expectations and also beating user growth estimates in a rebound from previous troubles with ad platform bugs and unusually low seasonal demand.

news_items.headline: 'Giga Texas?' Musk asks Twitter users to vote on new gigafactory
news_items.lede: Elon Musk, the billionaire chief executive officer of Tesla Inc <TSLA.O>, went on Twitter to ask users if the electric carmaker should build a new gigafactory in Texas.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Tesla CEO Elon Musk speaks about new Autopilot features during a Tesla event in Palo Alto, California October 14, 2015. REUTERS/Beck Diefenbach/File Photo

news_items.headline: IN BRIEF: Twitter hires ex-EFF attorney who repped Wikimedia, Reddit
news_items.lede: A digital rights attorney who has represented the Electronic Frontier Foundation, Buzzfeed Inc and the Freedom of the Press Foundation has joined Twitter as its director, product counsel.

news_items.headline: Microsoft, Twitter, others urge 4th Circuit to keep 'public charge' rule blocked
news_items.lede: Microsoft Corp, Twitter Inc, LinkedIn Corp and approximately 100 tech firms and other companies have asked a U.S. appeals court to uphold a judge's order blocking a Trump administration rule that would deny residency to aspiring immigrants deemed likely to require government...

news_items.headline: 'Boneheads' no more? Fed's rate cuts appear to defuse Trump's Twitter rage
news_items.lede: After three interest rate cuts and a fresh round of record highs for U.S. stock markets, has President Donald Trump lost interest in the Federal Reserve?
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: U.S. President Donald Trump delivers remarks during a campaign rally at the Giant Center in Hershey, Pennsylvania, U.S., December 10, 2019. REUTERS/Tom Brenner

news_items.headline: Twitter plans to build 'decentralized standard' for social networks
news_items.lede: Twitter Inc plans to set up an independent research group to create an "open and decentralized" system for social networks, CEO Jack Dorsey said on Wednesday, which could relieve pressure on the company to appease critics of its content policies but also give rise to a new...
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey testifies before the House Energy and Commerce Committee hearing on Twitter’s algorithms and content monitoring on Capitol Hill in Washington, U.S., September 5, 2018. REUTERS/Chris Wattie

news_items.headline: Twitter plans to build a "decentralized standard" for social networks
news_items.lede: Twitter Inc plans to set up an independent research group to create an "open and decentralized standard" for social media networks, a model which the microblogging platform aspires to follow, Chief Executive Officer Jack Dorsey said on Wednesday.

news_items.headline: Calif. appeals court shoots down class cert bid in Twitter sex bias case
news_items.lede: A California state appeals court has ruled that Twitter Inc's lack of a company-wide policy on job promotions precludes certification of a class of female software engineers who claim the social media giant routinely promoted men over women.

news_items.headline: U.S. solar industry urges Twitter campaign to 'punch back' at White House
news_items.lede: The top U.S. solar industry trade group on Wednesday urged members to use social media to hit back in a dispute with the White House over whether the Trump administration's tariffs on imported panels are killing or creating American jobs.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: An array of solar panels is seen in the desert near Victorville, California, U.S. March 28, 2018. REUTERS/Lucy Nicholson

news_items.headline: U.S. solar industry urges Twitter campaign to 'punch back' at White House
news_items.lede: The top U.S. solar industry trade group on Wednesday urged members to use social media to "punch back" in an escalating dispute over whether the Trump administration's tariffs on imported panels are killing or creating American jobs.

news_items.headline: Twitter makes global changes to comply with privacy laws
news_items.lede: Twitter Inc is updating its global privacy policy to give users more information about what data advertisers might receive and is launching a site to provide clarity on its data protection efforts, the company said on Monday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Twitter App loads on an iPhone in this illustration photograph taken in Los Angeles, California, U.S., July 22, 2019.    REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Former Twitter worker accused of spying for Saudi Arabia can be released on bond
news_items.lede: A former Twitter Inc employee accused of spying for Saudi Arabia may be freed pending trial, a U.S. District Court judge ruled on Thursday.
news_items.img_cap: Ahmad Abouammo, a former Twitter Inc employee accused of spying for Saudi Arabia, leaves Santa Rita jail after being freed pending trial, in Dublin, California, U.S. November 21, 2019.  REUTERS/Kate Munsch

news_items.headline: Twitter tightens bans on political ads and causes ahead of 2020 U.S. election
news_items.lede: Twitter Inc on Friday said its political advertising ban will include references to political candidates or legislation, and it will not allow ads that advocate for a certain outcome on social and political causes.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Facebook, Google and Twitter logos are seen in this combination photo from Reuters files. REUTERS/File Photo

news_items.headline: U.S. accuses two former Twitter employees of spying for Saudi Arabia
news_items.lede: Two former employees of Twitter and a third man from Saudi Arabia face U.S. charges of spying for the kingdom by digging up private user data and giving it to Saudi officials in exchange for payment, a complaint from the Department of Justice shows.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: The Twitter App loads on an iPhone in this illustration photograph taken in Los Angeles, California, U.S., July 22, 2019.    REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo

news_items.headline: Two former Twitter employees accused of spying for Saudi Arabia
news_items.lede: Two former employees of Twitter and a third man from Saudi Arabia face U.S. charges of spying for the kingdom by digging up private user data and giving it to Saudi officials in exchange for payment, according to a complaint filed on Wednesday. (Reporting by Diane Bartz;...

news_items.headline: Musk to go off Twitter ... again
news_items.lede: Elon Musk is going offline from Twitter <TWTR.N> after questioning "the good" of the social networking site.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: SpaceX owner and Tesla CEO Elon Musk listens during a conversation with legendary game designer Todd Howard (not pictured) at the E3 gaming convention in Los Angeles, California, U.S., June 13, 2019.  REUTERS/Mike Blake

news_items.headline: Facebook, Google, Twitter urged to do more to combat fake news in EU
news_items.lede: Facebook <FB.O>, Google <GOOGL.O> and Twitter <TWTR.N> must do more to tackle fake news or face regulatory action, the European Commission said on Tuesday.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: Stickers bearing the Facebook logo are pictured at Facebook Inc's F8 developers conference in San Jose, California, U.S., April 30, 2019.  REUTERS/Stephen Lam

news_items.headline: Twitter ad platform suffers tech glitches, hitting revenue; shares tumble
news_items.lede: Twitter Inc posted worse-than-expected quarterly revenue and profit on Thursday, plagued by technical issues that hurt its advertising, and unusually low demand over the summer, sending its shares down about 20%.
news_items.img_cap: FILE PHOTO: A 3D-printed logo for Twitter is seen in this picture illustration made in Zenica, Bosnia and Herzegovina on January 26, 2016.  REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

news_items.headline: CORRECTED-UPDATE 3-Twitter ad platform suffers tech glitches, hitting revenue; shares tumble
news_items.lede: Twitter Inc posted worse-than-expected quarterly revenue and profit on Thursday, plagued by technical issues that hurt its advertising, and unusually low demand over the summer, sending its shares down about 20%.
